title: Autoimmune-like hepatitis induced by drugs: Still many unanswered questions.
abstract: Drug-induced autoimmune-like hepatitis (DI-ALH) is an increasingly recognized phenotype within the spectrum of drug-induced liver injury. Several drugs, including nitrofurantoin, minocycline, hydralazine, methyldopa and infliximab, have a well-documented capacity to induce DI-ALH. Distinguishing DI-ALH from classic
